source:
import { motion } from "motion/react"; import Section from "@ui/section"; import DonateForm from "@components/forms/donate-form"; import { SectionTitleType, TSection } from "@utils/types"; import { scrollUpVariants } from "@utils/variants"; const AnimatedDonateForm = motion(DonateForm); type TProps = TSection & { data: { section_title?: SectionTitleType; }; }; const DonateFormArea = ({ data: { section_title }, space }: TProps) => { return (
{/* Intro Section */}
{section_title && ( Support Our Mission )} Your generosity fuels the technology veterans count on, sustains life-changing mentorship, and accelerates a platform built to stay ahead of the industry. Because of you, those who served arent just finding their place in tech theyre leading it.
{/* Donation Impact Metrics */}
300+ Veterans Served
90% Job Placement Rate
40% Average Salary Increase
80% Felt Supported for Learning Journey
{/* Donation Form */} {/* Testimonials */}
How Your Support Makes an Impact

"Participating in Vets Who Code significantly boosted my confidence confidence and honed my skills. Since completing the program, I have secured a role as a Staff Software Engineer at Jump, a ticketing startup focused on live events."

Josh Morton

Army Veteran, Software Developer

"The impact of VWC on my career has been profound. The knowledge and skills I gained have greatly enhanced my career. In just two years, I more than doubled my salary, providing financial security for my family and allowing my wife to stay home with our kids. But more than that, I've grown as a person and as a professional, and that's something no amount of money can buy."

Cameron Porter.

US Army, Software Engineer

"Without a doubt, I would hire from Vets Who Code again. The experience has been overwhelmingly positive, and I believe in veterans' immense value to our team and our healthcare mission."

Darnell Settles III

Director of Web and Digital Strategy, Methodist Le Bonheur Healthcare

); }; export default DonateFormArea;

suppressedMessages.message: Unexpected any. Specify a different type.

suggestions.desc: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.

suppressedMessages.message: React Hook useCallback has missing dependencies: 'filteringCB', 'items', 'pathname', and 'router'. Either include them or remove the dependency array. If 'filteringCB' changes too often, find the parent component that defines it and wrap that definition in useCallback.

suggestions.desc: Update the dependencies array to be: [filteringCB, items, pathname, router, value]

suppressedMessages.message: React Hook useEffect has missing dependencies: 'filteringCB' and 'items'. Either include them or remove the dependency array. If 'filteringCB' changes too often, find the parent component that defines it and wrap that definition in useCallback.

suggestions.desc: Update the dependencies array to be: [filteringCB, items, type]

suppressedMessages.message: React Hook useEffect has missing dependencies: 'itemToFetch', 'items', and 'page'. Either include them or remove the dependency array. If 'setItemsToShow' needs the current value of 'items', you can also switch to useReducer instead of useState and read 'items' in the reducer.

suggestions.desc: Update the dependencies array to be: [router.query, pageNumb, page, items, itemToFetch]

suppressedMessages.message: React Hook useCallback has missing dependencies: 'allItems', 'router', and 'sortingCB'. Either include them or remove the dependency array. If 'sortingCB' changes too often, find the parent component that defines it and wrap that definition in useCallback.

suggestions.desc: Update the dependencies array to be: [allItems, router, sortValue, sortingCB]

suppressedMessages.message: React Hook useEffect has missing dependencies: 'allItems' and 'sortingCB'. Either include them or remove the dependency array. If 'sortingCB' changes too often, find the parent component that defines it and wrap that definition in useCallback.

suggestions.desc: Update the dependencies array to be: [allItems, sortBy, sortingCB]

suggestions.desc: Update the dependencies array to be: [search, searchCurriculum]
